== Definition of mononucleosis syndrome ==
- presence of '''more than 50% of mononucleated elements'' (lymphocytes and monocytes) '''among leukocytes''' on the blood count, due to a '''hyperlymphocytosis''' '''([[Blood count interpretation SD-223|blood count interpretation]]; [[Leukocyte abnormality SD-216|leukocyte abnormality]])'''''

- '''and'''' '''≥ 10% activated lymphocytes on the blood smear ([[Prescription and analysis of blood smear SD-222|prescription and analysis of blood smear]])''''

question.title: What is the definition of mononucleosis syndrome?
question.description: A blood test reveals a specific condition characterized by an abnormal increase in certain types of white blood cells.

option_a.title: A blood test shows a decrease in the number of white blood cells
option_a.description: A blood test reveals a specific condition characterized by a lack of certain types of white blood cells.

option_b.title: A blood test shows a significant increase in lymphocytes and monocytes
option_b.description: A blood test reveals a specific condition characterized by an abnormal increase in the number of lymphocytes and monocytes.

option_c.title: A blood test shows a decrease in the percentage of activated lymphocytes
option_c.description: A blood test reveals a specific condition characterized by a lack of activation of certain white blood cells.

option_d.title: A blood test shows a total of 10-50% of mononucleated elements among leukocytes
option_d.description: A blood test reveals a specific condition characterized by a normal range of white blood cells.
